intro: Jumellea zaratananae, commonly known as the Zaratanana shrub, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season, followed by small, berry-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss. Conservation efforts are essential to protect this unique botanical species.
